meanings.definition: Emcees: serves as a verb, meaning to act as a master of ceremonies at an event.
meanings.sent1: At the talent show, Sarah emcees the event with enthusiasm.
meanings.sent2: He emcees the wedding reception, making sure everything runs smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The cat emcees the gathering of birds in the backyard, pretending to be the host.
meanings.sent4: Her smile emcees the room, lighting up the faces of everyone present.
meanings.sent5: The sun emcees the sky, bringing warmth and light to the world.

meanings.definition: Emcees: serves as a noun, referring to individuals who serve as masters of ceremonies at events.
meanings.sent1: The emcees at the concert kept the audience engaged throughout the show.
meanings.sent2: She was one of the emcees at the award ceremony, introducing each segment with grace.
meanings.sent3: The emcees at the party wore colorful hats, adding a fun touch to the event.
meanings.sent4: The emcees of the game show guided the contestants through each round with skill.
meanings.sent5: The emcees of the event were dressed in formal attire, setting a professional tone for the evening.
